PERSONA:
Name: Ethan Thompson

Age: 19 years

Sex: Male

Race: White

Ethnicity: Assuming non-Hispanic, as it is the most common category among White Americans.

Location: Lives in Casper, the second-largest city in Wyoming, in a suburban neighborhood with a mix of single-family homes and apartments.

Education: Currently a sophomore at Casper College, pursuing a degree in Business Administration with a focus on Entrepreneurship. Graduated from a public high school in his hometown in Wyoming with a 3.8 GPA and was part of the National Honor Society.

Household: Primary householder and in a domestic partnership with his long-term girlfriend, who is also a student at Casper College. They share a two-bedroom apartment near campus.

Employment: Works part-time as a sales associate at an outdoor gear store in downtown Casper, earning $12 per hour and working approximately 20 hours a week.

Income: Combined household income is around $45,000 per year, with Ethan's girlfriend working part-time as a waitress. They split expenses equally and prioritize saving for their education and future.

Language: Fluent in English, with no other languages spoken at home.

Citizenship and Birth: Born in Denver, Colorado, but moved to Wyoming with his family at a young age. Holds US citizenship by birth.

Economic Concerns: As a college student, Ethan is concerned about the rising cost of tuition, student loan debt, and the job market after graduation. He also worries about the economic stability of his community, as Wyoming's economy is heavily reliant on the energy industry, which can be unpredictable.

Family Structure: Ethan's parents are divorced, and he has a younger sister who lives with their mother in another part of Wyoming. His father lives in Colorado and works as an engineer. Ethan's family is supportive of his education and career goals, but they do not provide significant financial assistance.

Homeownership: Does not own a home, but hopes to purchase a house in the next five years after graduating and securing a stable job.

Transportation: Owns a used 2015 Toyota Corolla, which he purchased with the help of his parents.

Healthcare: Has health insurance through his part-time job, but is concerned about the affordability and accessibility of healthcare in rural Wyoming.

Taxes: Files taxes jointly with his girlfriend, claiming the standard deduction and taking advantage of education credits.

This persona is designed to reflect the complexities and challenges faced by a young adult in Wyoming, navigating higher education, part-time work, and long-term financial planning.
